item.dc:creator: @skinzoskinz skinzoskinz
item.description:
@skinzoskinz wrote:

Darn… this is getting annoying cos i can’t see why some spec on players and other dont :S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 02:17:23 am[/size][hr]Anyone have any idea at all?

Basically i need to know if there is a special on players based on the code above and if i can change it… i’ve been looking for a while and no luck

Thanks!

item.title: Special Attacks in the wildy, using Customs!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Dragon Dagger On Player

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 5698 && specialAmount > 24){ specialAtk(true, 25, 252, 0x426); getHit(8); usingSpecial = true; }

Dragon Dagger On NPC

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 5698 && specialAmount > 24){ specialAtkNPC(true, 25, 252, 0x426); npcDamage(8); }

Kinda getting the idea?

Read full topic

item.title: Special Attacks in the wildy, using Customs!
item.dc:creator: @skinzoskinz skinzoskinz
item.description:
@skinzoskinz wrote:

I’ve created special attacks on some custom items, such as the Statius Warhammer and Vesta Longsword… and they work perfectly on NPCs, but they don’t activate in the wilderness…

Anyone know why? … Any idea how to get specials to work in the wildy?

Heres some code:

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 13643 && specialAmount <= 49) // stat ham { specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; sendMessage("You do not have enough special energy left."); }

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 13643 && specialAmount >= 50) { // stat ham startAnimation(1667); maulSpec(); specialDamage = 50 + misc.random(20); specialAmount -= 50; }

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 13643 && specialAmount >= 50) { animation(59, EnemyY, EnemyX); animation(435, EnemyY, EnemyX); animation(346, EnemyY, EnemyX); calculateSpecial(); hitDiff = specialDamage; usingSpecial = false; specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; }

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2009, 02:16:29 pm[/size][hr]I added the “maul spec” bit in there to see if it would work, because i can spec in the wildy with a G maul…

The code of MaulSpec() is:

[code] public void maulSpec() {
if (IsAttackingNPC && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4153) {
setAnimation(1667);
actionTimer = 4;
SpecDamgNPC(30);
DDS2Damg = true;
DDStimer = 1;
resetAnimation();
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
SpecDamgNPC(30);
SpecialDelay -= 1;
} else if (IsAttacking && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4153) {
int j = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int k = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
int l = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].playerLevel[playerHitpoints];

        SpecDamg(30);
        DDS2Damg = true;
        DDStimer = 1;
        startAnimation(1667);
        actionTimer = 4;
        teleportToX = absX;
        teleportToY = absY;
        SpecialDelay -= 1;
    }[/code]

Read full topic
